entries.title: Covid in China: WHO calls on Beijing to strengthen its response
entries.description: As Covid surges in China, the WHO meets Chinese officials and calls for more real-time data.

entries.title: New Year Honours: Pat Jennings, Dara McAnulty and John Bennett on NI list
entries.description: The goalkeeping great and Radio Ulster presenter are among the Northern Ireland recipients.

entries.title: New Year Honours 2023: Lionesses recognised, Denise Lewis made a dame
entries.description: England players Leah Williamson and Beth Mead and former Olympic heptathlon champion Denise Lewis are among those recognised in the New Year's Honours

entries.title: Scotland footballers named in New Year Honours list
entries.description: Business leaders, a master distiller and a Beano illustrator are among those recognised by the King.

entries.title: Knighthoods for MPs who caused Boris Johnson headaches
entries.description: Chris Bryant and Julian Lewis are among the political figures recognised in the New Year Honours list.

entries.title: New Year Honours 2023: Grayson Perry and Brian May lead cultural roll call
entries.description: Artist Grayson Perry and Queen's Brian May are among the cultural figures in the New Year Honours.

entries.title: New Year Honours 2023: Brian May and Lionesses on list
entries.description: The Queen guitarist is knighted in a list that also celebrates the Lionesses' Euro 2022 victory.

entries.title: Liverpool 2-1 Leicester: Wout Faes own goals gift Reds victory
entries.description: Wout Faes scores two own goals as Liverpool come from behind to beat Leicester in their final Premier League game of 2022.

entries.title: Pelé: Why black Brazilians like me mourn the King
entries.description: Pelé won his first World Cup only 70 years after slavery was finally abolished in Brazil.

entries.title: Vivienne Westwood: Designers on her influence and legacy
entries.description: Three designers, spanning generations, recall the influence of the pioneering fashion creator.

entries.title: Cristiano Ronaldo joins Saudi Arabian side Al Nassr
entries.description: Cristiano Ronaldo joins Saudi Arabian side Al Nassr on a deal that runs until 2025.

entries.title: URC: Edinburgh 25-32 Glasgow Warriors - Horne stars as visitors win 1872 Cup
entries.description: Glasgow Warriors beat Edinburgh for the second time in seven days to win the 1872 Cup and move up a place in the United Rugby Championship.

entries.title: Andrew Tate: Romanian police to hold influencer for 30 days
entries.description: The controversial influencer is detained in an investigation into rape and human trafficking.

entries.title: Police arrest suspect in murder of four Idaho university students
entries.description: The arrest comes six weeks after four students were found stabbed to death in their beds.

entries.title: UK set to require negative Covid test for China arrivals
entries.description: The expected move comes amid surging cases and concerns about data provided by the Chinese government.

entries.title: Ukraine hit by fresh wave of Iran drones - officials
entries.description: All 16 drones - of which seven were aimed at Kyiv - were destroyed, Ukrainian representatives say.

entries.title: Chinese fighter jet flies 20 feet from US military plane
entries.description: The US said its pilot had to evade the jet to avoid colliding in international airspace over the South China Sea.

entries.title: Steve Rosenberg in Moscow: Has the war changed Russia?
entries.description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg takes to Moscow's streets to see how the Ukraine war has changed Russia.

entries.title: Returns show Trump paid no taxes in 2020
entries.description: The former president's returns showed big losses, complicated business set-ups and no taxes paid in 2020.

entries.title: Do restrictions on travel work against Covid?
entries.description: Is there evidence that travel restrictions help stop the spread of coronavirus?

entries.title: Severe flooding causes road and rail disruption in Scotland
entries.description: Sepa is bracing for a "potentially significant event" as rivers continue to rise in southern Scotland.

entries.title: Norfolk fireman Carl Mills dies at fire station
entries.description: Passers-by and emergency services tried to help Carl Mills, who had 38 years of "dedicated" service.

entries.title: Glasgow A&E doctors want major incident declared
entries.description: A&E staff at the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital said they had "grave concerns" over patient safety.

entries.title: Trump's tax returns released after years-long effort
entries.description: The former president had long sought to keep his records from being seen by the public.

entries.title: Wallasey pub shooting: Elle Edwards's family needs answers, say police
entries.description: Christmas Eve shooting victim Elle Edwards, 26, was a "beautiful and bright star", her family says.

entries.title: Pele: Brazil legend's extraordinary career in pictures
entries.description: From winning the World Cup at 17 to being widely regarded as the greatest footballer of all time - Pele's incredible life in pictures.

entries.title: Harlequins: Joe Marler charged over Jake Heenan comments
entries.description: England and Harlequins prop Joe Marler is charged by the Rugby Football Union for conduct prejudicial to the game.

entries.title: Andrew Tate: The self-proclaimed misogynist influencer
entries.description: The 36-year-old former kickboxer has said women should "bear responsibility" for sexual assault.

entries.title: Pele: Premier League and EFL players to wear black armbands to honour footballing great
entries.description: Premier League and English Football League players are set to wear black armbands and hold a minute's applause to honour Brazil football legend Pele.

entries.title: 'Thank you, King': Brazil lights up in honour of Pele
entries.description: Brazil begins first day of mourning the late footballing legend as landmarks are lit up in tribute.

entries.title: Flu rise warning from NHS in England
entries.description: NHS chief warns against complacency and says "risk of serious illness is very real".

entries.title: Cody Fisher stabbing: Birmingham nightclub's licence suspended
entries.description: A police officer's account of the aftermath describes "a scene of chaos and drug use".

entries.title: Wallasey shooting: Elle Edwards murder suspect recalled to prison
entries.description: A man, 30, has been recalled to jail and a woman, 19, is also released on bail, police say.

entries.title: United Cup: Great Britain win tie against Australia after Harriet Dart's victory
entries.description: Great Britain's Harriet Dart defeats Maddison Inglis in straight sets to seal the team's tie win over Australia at the United Cup.

entries.title: Cricket: Select your teams of the year & make your 2023 predictions
entries.description: Pick your international cricket teams of the year and then make a few predictions for 2023.

entries.title: NBA: Eleven Orlando Magic & Dallas Pistons players suspended after scuffle
entries.description: Eleven players are suspended by the NBA following a mass scuffle during the Detroit Pistons' 121-101 victory over the Orlando Magic.

entries.title: Buses: More cuts to services to come, operators warn
entries.description: Campaigners say a temporary £2 maximum fare will not stem a fall in passengers, amid service cuts.

entries.title: Leah Williamson: From gamble as captain to face of women's football
entries.description: England captain Leah Williamson discusses their historic Euro 2022 triumph, her spiritual side and the importance of family.

entries.title: Rishabh Pant: India wicketkeeper in hospital after car crash
entries.description: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant "dozed off" before his car flipped twice and caught fire in Uttarakhand.

entries.title: Worsley man given year to live cancer-free after Christie's drug trial
entries.description: Robert Glynn says getting the all-clear after being told he had 12 months to live was "overwhelming".

entries.title: Aung San Suu Kyi jailed for a further seven years
entries.description: Myanmar's military junta has now sentenced the former leader to a total of 33 years behind bars.

entries.title: Belarus says it downed Ukraine air defence missile
entries.description: Belarus summoned the Ukrainian ambassador, after saying it shot down a Ukrainian air defence missile.

entries.title: Strep A: At least 30 children have died in UK since mid-September
entries.description: Since 19 September, 122 people in England have died from an invasive form of the bacterial infection, UKHSA data shows.

entries.title: Pele: The player who united a nation
entries.description: Pele was a footballing legend the world over, but for people in Brazil he was so much more.

entries.title: Venugopal Dhoot: How debt and bad loan led to Videocon owner's downfall
entries.description: Venugopal Dhoot was arrested earlier this week in a case of fraud, which he denies.

entries.title: Abba's Chiquitita: Guatemala school uses Unicef funds
entries.description: Abba gave the copyright of hit song Chiquitita to Unicef - who use the profits to fund education.

entries.title: Andrew Tate detained in Romania over human trafficking case
entries.description: The controversial online influencer has reportedly been detained in Romania.

entries.title: 2022 in pictures: Striking photos from around the world
entries.description: A selection of some of the most powerful pictures taken by news agency photographers around the world this year.

entries.title: National Archives: Swindon move for Millennium Dome proposed
entries.description: Files reveal Tony Blair's government was once offered the chance to move the venue out of London.

entries.title: National Archives: Tony Blair said Putin should be on 'top table'
entries.description: The then prime minister believed Russia's president was at heart a "patriot", archive files reveal.

entries.title: The high street shops thriving after a tough year
entries.description: It has been a tough year with more challenges to come, but some retailers are proving the fittest can survive.

entries.title: World Darts Championship: Gerwyn Price reaches quarter-finals
entries.description: World number one Gerwyn Price advances to the World Darts Championship quarter-finals with a 4-1 win against Jose de Sousa at Alexandra Palace.

entries.title: The Papers: 'King of football' dies and 'no magic wand for pay'
entries.description: Tributes to Brazilian football icon Pele following his death and the financial toll of strikes lead the front pages.
